newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS THURSDAY MIXED ON UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS THURSDAY MIXED ON UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed firmer on the U.S. dollar and the rand but was quoted weaker against key European currencies after a fairly busy Thursday interbank session.
"Today was a very active day. We saw some good two-way trading but the rates were quite stable," one dealer commented.
But dealers said the latest surge in annual inflation, which went up to 22.4 percent in April from 19.9 percent in March, might soon start putting depreciatory pressure on the local unit.
"If we look at the fundamentals, there's now room for the Zimbabwe dollar to depreciate if we are to maintaine our competitiveness against other currencies," one dealer said.
The local currency finished on Thursday at 11.3000/3100 against the U.S. dollar from 11.3050/3150 and was also quoted firmer on the rand at 2.5210/5250 compared to 2.5230/5270 the previous day.
It however lost versus sterling to 18.5275/5540 from 18.5070/5370 and to 6.6500/6570 from 6.6235/6330 against Germany's mark.
